name: Cheddar Biscuits with Chive Butter
author: RuthE
summary: Chives are the first herb to come up in the spring, and their delicate flavor pairs well with these biscuits. A little bit of Parmesan cheese makes the flavor of Cheddar cheese really pop; try it next time you make mac and cheese!
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Beat softened butter, chives, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl until well-combined and smooth
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Stir flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl
Cut cold butter into flour mixture with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles oatmeal
Add Cheddar cheese and Parmesan cheese; toss to coat
Stir buttermilk into flour mixture until dough is just-moistened
Turn dough out onto a floured work surface and gently knead until dough comes together, about 6 to 8 times
Roll dough into a 9-inch square (1/2 inch thick) with a floured rolling pin
Cut dough lengthwise into 4 strips and crosswise into 6 strips
Place biscuits on a baking sheet and brush tops with beaten egg
Bake biscuits in the preheated oven until golden, about 15 minutes
Transfer to a rack and cool until warm, at least 15 minutes
